intro: Oenothera hilgardii, commonly known as the Hilgard’s evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that open in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. Oenothera hilgardii is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other evening primrose species.
